12:48.race_name: Book Day Dancin On 11 April Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qual') (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Beat a next-time-out winner fairly comfortably at Southwell in November; leading contender
runners.name: Next Twist
runners.spotlight: Safely held when sixth on seasonal/hurdle debut in October but combination of first-time hood and much more positive tactics enabled him to beat a next-time-out winner fairly comfortably at Southwell (2m, good to soft) the following month; good chance.

runners.comment: Kelso novice winner in November; carries the penalty in a stronger race
runners.name: Triple Crown Ted
runners.spotlight: Built upon promising seasonal/hurdle debut when winning seven-runner Kelso novice (2m, soft) in November; should have more to offer but carries 7lb penalty in a stronger race.

runners.comment: Always behind on hurdle debut and was an early faller on latest outing
runners.name: Belvedere Bhoy
runners.spotlight: Always behind on last month's hurdling debut at Kelso and fell at third flight there two weeks ago; stable has much more obvious chance with Triple Crown Ted.

runners.comment: Clear second to useful rival in big-field Ludlow novice last month; major player here
runners.name: Bras dOr
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far in good Cheltenham maiden (2m, soft) on seasonal/hurdle debut in November and probably ran to similar level when clear second to useful rival in 15-runner Ludlow novice (2m, good to soft) last month; has a big role to play here.

runners.comment: Well beaten at huge odds in two C&D novice hurdles towards the end of last year
runners.name: Ck OMara
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at huge odds in two C&D novice hurdles towards end of last year.

runners.comment: Has made a disappointing start to his hurdling career and remains best watched
runners.name: Coylton King
runners.spotlight: Displayed clear promise when fourth of 12 in soft-ground course bumper just under a year ago but has made a disappointing start to his hurdling career this season and remains best watched.

runners.comment: Runner-up in a point and a bumper; can make his presence felt again on hurdling debut
runners.name: Kilnesare Flight
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on Irish point debut in autumn 2024 and filled same position in Carlisle bumper (also on soft) on rules debut six weeks ago; no surprise if he is in the thick of things again on this hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Showed ability in bumpers last year but makes hurdling debut after 251-day absence
runners.name: Luckie Devil
runners.spotlight: Second but no match to very useful rival on bumper debut at Newcastle (good) last March and his second bumper run was disappointing; makes hurdling debut after 251-day absence with first-time hood fitted; others look stronger.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten on both hurdling starts, latterly on seasonal/stable debut in December
runners.name: Bennys Jenny
runners.spotlight: Won Irish point in the spring of 2024 but made low-key hurdle debut over C&D for Stuart Coltherd last winter; again soundly beaten when reappearing for Nick Alexander at Kelso (2m5f) last month.

runners.comment: Struggled in two Perth hurdles last summer; returns from a break with hood added
runners.name: Breaking Ground
runners.spotlight: Remote when placed in good-ground Irish point last spring and struggled in two Perth hurdles in the summer; returns from a break with hood fitted.

13:18.race_name: Wicked Afternoon Tea Last Few Places EBF Mares' 'National Hunt' Novices' Hurdle (EBF Qual') (GBB)

runners.comment: Won a handicap last month and is now 2-8 over hurdles; no easy task under 12lb penalty
runners.name: Just Her Type
runners.spotlight: Kept on well to win Southwell handicap (2m4f, good to soft) last month and is now 2-8 over hurdles; more exposed than some of these and faces a fairly tough task under her 12lb penalty but will be fine on the slower ground and ought to give another good account.

runners.comment: Won comfortably by over 6f at Warwick (2m3f) in November and commands respect
runners.name: Dream Shadow
runners.owner: M Doocey S Doocey & P J Doocey
runners.spotlight: Placed in two Listed bumpers last season and built upon her promising hurdle debut when winning comfortably by over 6l at Warwick (2m3f, good to soft) in November; looks quite useful and commands respect.

runners.comment: Shock winner at Perth (2m) in October but pulled up over 2m3f the following month
runners.name: Just An Artist
runners.spotlight: Improved to cause 125-1 shock at Perth (2m, soft) in October, her second hurdling start, but raced too freely and was pulled up when upped to 2m3f in November; has the hood refitted but others look much less risky.

runners.comment: Below form in 3m handicap last month but has possibilities if back on song here
runners.name: Lets Mingle
runners.spotlight: Won small-field Perth maiden (2m4f, good) last spring and returned from break with good second on handicap debut at Kelso (2m6f, good) in October; drops back in trip after a lesser effort over 3m last month but still enters calculations.

runners.comment: Went close in Listed race last month and was a narrow winner at Fontwell on Sunday
runners.name: Park Princess
runners.spotlight: Scored on hurdling debut at Ludlow (2m5f, good) in November and went very close in Haydock Listed race (2m3f, good to soft) on next outing; left it late before leading close home under determined ride to justify skinny odds at Fontwell (2m1f, soft) on Sunday but, nevertheless, will have strong claims if she makes a quick reappearance despite the 12lb penalty.

runners.comment: Bought for 10,000gns after finishing second on Irish point debut in November; rules debut
runners.name: Largy Rose
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to useful Irish hurdler Largy Hill; bought for 10,000gns after finishing second in slow-ground Irish point in November; should have a future under rules but this is a tough introduction.

runners.comment: Safely held in a Listed race last time but probably still has potential; not ruled out
runners.name: Roses All The Way
runners.spotlight: Promising in bumpers last season (placed in a Listed race) and was very respectable third on hurdle debut at Sedgefield (2m4f, soft) in November; safely held in a Listed race since but probably still has potential.

13:48.race_name: Book Your Celebration @westernhousehotel.co.uk Handicap Hurdle (Go North Brindisi Breeze Qualifier)

runners.comment: Clearcut C&D winner when upped in trip for last month's handicap debut; major player
runners.name: Kelvin Forlonge
runners.spotlight: Evidently well suited by step up to 3m when keeping on well for clearcut C&D (heavy) success on handicap debut six weeks ago; 6lb higher today but has plenty of scope for further progress and makes obvious appeal.

runners.comment: Placed on seasonal debut but pulled up since; headgear switched
runners.name: Piaff Bubbles
runners.spotlight: Placed off slightly higher mark over C&D (soft) just under a year ago and returned from break with pretty good effort in November but has modest 1-15 strike-rate over hurdles and needs to rebound from last month's poor run; hood replaced by refitted cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Narrow C&D winner in March but has not fired on either appearance this season
runners.name: Monsieur Le Fuzz
runners.spotlight: Battled well for narrow C&D (soft) win in first-time cheekpieces in March, his second handicap, but has not fired on either appearance this season and returns here with something to prove; tongue-tie added.

runners.comment: Not getting any younger but last month's C&D second was a good effort
runners.name: Shoeshine Boy
runners.spotlight: Not getting any younger but his staying-on second behind Kelvin Forlonge over C&D (heavy) in early December was a good effort and he wasn't far off the pace when falling two out at Wetherby (2m, soft) last time.

runners.comment: Good third at Navan last month and Sean Bowen takes the ride; high on the list
runners.name: Gather Yourself
runners.spotlight: Irish raider; 0-9 over hurdles but ran well before fading into third at Navan (3m1f, soft to heavy) last month and has the services of Sean Bowen here; high on the list.

runners.comment: C&D winner last year; below form last time but has claims if judged on earlier Hexham run
runners.name: Maura Jeanne
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner last season, latterly by 7l over C&D (soft) in February; below form at Haydock recently but is eased in grade and has claims if judged on her Hexham second (2m7f, good to soft) two runs ago.

runners.comment: Second in first-time cheekpieces last month; moves up from 2m3f; a possible
runners.name: Holly Bird
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles but seemed to respond well to first-time cheekpieces when second at Catterick (2m3f, good to soft) last month; possibilities if suited by the new trip.

runners.comment: Returned from long layoff with fairly encouraging run but seems best on good ground
runners.name: Better Be Definite
runners.spotlight: Dual good-ground winner in 2024 (once over C&D); returned from long absence with reasonably encouraging run in November but needs to build on that performance and the slower ground is a worry.

runners.comment: Showed nothing more than minor promise in four novice/maiden hurdles; handicap debut
runners.name: Blue Indigo
runners.spotlight: Showed nothing more than minor promise in four novice/maiden hurdles (2m4f-2m6f) towards end of last year; upped in trip for handicap debut and open to improvement but others have more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Well beaten on handicap debut in June; now with new stable; 7lb wrong
runners.name: Nae Bother At A
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on handicap debut for Gary Rutherford at Perth (3m, good) last June and effectively 5lb higher from out of the weights on this stable debut; considered only if lively in the betting.

14:18.race_name: Book Coral Scottish Grand National "Chasing Excellence" Novices' Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Won Listed novice hurdle last season and has made promising start to chasing career
runners.name: Fingle Bridge
runners.spotlight: 2-2 over hurdles last season, including a Listed win; kept on for never-dangerous second behind subsequent Grade 1 winner Lulamba on chasing debut at Exeter (2m1f, good to soft) in November and was subsequently left alone to win a match race; still unexposed; respected.

runners.comment: Useful novice hurdler last season; won Wetherby handicap on chase debut; good prospect
runners.name: Meetmebythesea
runners.spotlight: Launched hurdling career with three wins last season and ran big race when close third in always-competitive EBF Final at Sandown (2m4f, good to soft) in March; justified favouritism in Wetherby handicap (1m7f, soft) on chasing debut in November and remains a very good prospect.

runners.comment: Promising novice hurdler in 2024 but makes chasing debut after a long absence
runners.name: Big John Wayne
runners.spotlight: Won an Irish point in 2023 and looked promising on all three hurdling starts in 2024 but this chasing debut comes after a 454-day absence and he's against some very useful rivals.

runners.comment: G2 novice hurdle winner; not progressing in handicaps but still of interest on chase debut
runners.name: Dedicated Hero
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner last season, latterly in Grade 2 novice at Haydock (1m7f, soft); yet to make any further progress in handicaps this term but has contested some good races; interesting to see how he fares on this chasing debut.

runners.breeder: P Henry J Gandy & A Chevalier Du Fau
runners.comment: Second in C&D handicap on chasing debut; needs a good step forward today
runners.name: From The Clouds
runners.owner: Trotters International By A & L McLaren
runners.spotlight: 2-4 as a novice hurdler last season; made pretty good start to chasing career when second of five in soft-ground C&D handicap in November but will probably need to take a good step forward today.

14:48.race_name: Cheltenham Gold Cup Lunch @westernhousehotel Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Won good-ground Catterick chase in November but well held there since
runners.name: I See The Sea
runners.spotlight: 2-9 over fences, the latter win gained at Catterick (3m1f, good) in November; only 1lb higher today but disappointed over that C&D just after Christmas and is not sure to be suited by the slower ground here.

runners.comment: Point winner; placed on last month's handicap hurdle debut; interesting on chase debut
runners.name: Big Zouk
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 7yo who won a point in 2024 and was placed on last month's handicap hurdle debut at Newcastle (2m7f, good to soft); probably still has potential and looks very interesting on this chasing debut.

runners.comment: Didn't fire last time but is probably better judged on close second over C&D two runs ago
runners.name: Torosay
runners.spotlight: Lacked fluency and never really got competitive at Carlisle at the end of November but she stayed on well for clear second over C&D (soft) at start of that month and has obvious claims if judged on that performance.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Luy
runners.comment: Placed in both chases, more recently when second over C&D six weeks ago; respected
runners.name: Jirko
runners.spotlight: 0-8 under all codes but placed in both his chases, more recently when second over C&D (heavy) six weeks ago; may still have some potential and can make a bold bid from the front.

runners.comment: Safely held over C&D in November but that was after a break; still unexposed over fences
runners.name: Rob Roy Macgregor
runners.spotlight: Placed in big-field handicap hurdle here (3m, soft) last season and stuck to his task well when fourth on chasing debut at Hexham (3m, good to soft) last May; two lesser efforts have followed but the latter came after a break and he competes off another career-low mark today; swaps visor (worn once) for refitted cheekpieces; a possible.

runners.comment: Pulled up twice since mammoth absence; needs to prove some ability remains
runners.name: Maid Of Houxty
runners.spotlight: Came good at Newcastle (2m7f, heavy) in March 2023 but wasn't seen again until pulled up on consecutive outings at Carlisle in November and needs to prove some ability remains.

runners.comment: Pulled up on both starts this season; up in trip today; difficult to enthuse over
runners.name: Kingston Rock
runners.owner: J L And Mrs H R Gledson
runners.spotlight: Looked out of sorts when pulled up in 2m1f hurdle and 1m7f chase this season, and is now 0-17 overall; difficult to enthuse over on this first attempt at 3m; blinkers (worn once) and tongue-tie removed.

runners.comment: In poor form over hurdles this winter and has too much to prove on chase return
runners.name: Euchan Falls
runners.spotlight: Returned from break with two very poor hurdle runs here (3m/2m4f) this winter and has too much to prove on his return to fences; swaps cheekpieces for refitted visor and a first-time tongue-tie; 2lb wrong.

runners.comment: Went close at Hexham last spring but this 13yo is far too inconsistent to rely upon
runners.name: Muroor
runners.spotlight: Veteran who gave a good account when close second at Hexham (3m, good) last spring but remains without a win since 2020 and is far too inconsistent to rely upon; 3lb wrong.

15:18.race_name: Dream Weddings At Western House Hotel Handicap Hurdle (Go North Sea Pigeon Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Teenager; won here off much reduced mark last March; not in same form yet this season
runners.name: Thereisnodoubt
runners.spotlight: Teenager who exploited a much reduced mark over C&D (soft) on final start last season; not in same form on either outing this term, though, and younger rivals have more persuasive profiles.

runners.comment: Made all in Newcastle maiden last month; this is tougher but he can remain competitive
runners.name: Hes Bresilian
runners.owner: Fine Claret Racing & T S Ingham
runners.spotlight: Came good over hurdles at sixth attempt, making all in six-runner Newcastle maiden (2m1f, good to soft) last month; this handicap is more competitive but he should be fine on the forecast slower ground.

runners.comment: Not seen since encouraging seasonal debut over C&D in early November but still considered
runners.name: Dance Thief
runners.spotlight: Won over fences here (2m, good to soft) last season and was very respectable fifth of 11 over C&D (soft) when back over hurdles for reappearance run in early November; absent for another ten weeks since but still enters calculations.

runners.comment: Returned from long absence with 45l defeat on last month's British debut
runners.name: Jiair Madrik
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles in France in 2023 but returned from long absence with 45l defeat on last month's British debut (raced too freely); entitled to have needed that run and might settle better in first-time hood here but it takes a leap of faith to support him.

runners.comment: Placed when back over hurdles in October but latest run was slightly disappointing
runners.name: Two Auld Pals
runners.spotlight: Hurdle and multiple Flat winner; placed at Kelso (2m, good; also suited by soft) when back over hurdles in October but was slighty disappointing when upped to 2m4f last time and is not one to rely upon heavily nowadays.

runners.comment: Did not get competitive on first two stable runs; still worth a market check, though
runners.name: Mr Lincoln
runners.spotlight: Useful Flat racer who was placed on two of three hurdling starts in Ireland; did not get competitive on either start for new stable last month but is worth keeping an eye on in the betting; versatile ground-wise.

runners.comment: Ready course winner in November and in even better form when going close at Kelso recently
runners.name: Tread Softly Now
runners.spotlight: Won readily here (2m3f, soft) in November and posted another career-best performance when very close second at Kelso (2m2f, good to soft) a fortnight ago; must be considered in current form.

runners.comment: Well beaten on both starts for new stable this season and deserted by Sean Quinlan today
runners.name: Sao Carlos
runners.owner: A Balmer And Bolton Mill Racing
runners.spotlight: Pulled up over C&D when reverting to hurdles for seasonal/stable debut in November and finished last at Carlisle (2m3f, also soft) one month ago; needs to turn a corner and Sean Quinlan evidently prefers He's Bresilian today.

runners.comment: Pulled-up 66-1 shot here (2m4f) on recent stable debut
runners.name: Don Occhetti
runners.spotlight: Won good-ground chase for Dan Skelton in summer 2024 but was a pulled-up 66-1 shot when returning from long absence in recent soft-ground hurdle for new stable; drops back from 2m4f with tongue-tie added today.

runners.comment: 0-6 over hurdles but not beaten far in any of his three handicaps; likely contender
runners.name: Platin Moon
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles and has a tendency to race too freely but wasn't beaten far in his first three handicaps and may not have been suited by the stiff track at Carlisle when a weakening fifth (2m1f, soft) on latest occasion; can make his presence felt.

15:48.race_name: Sunday Roast At Western House Hotel Open National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Ready C&D winner on rules debut in November; makes obvious appeal
runners.name: Coconut Man
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on Irish point debut last April and made good start to rules career in November, readily beating Kingsman Mail by over 3l over C&D (soft); carries the penalty but still makes obvious appeal.

runners.comment: Held every chance before last-fence fall on Irish point debut in November; cost £125,000
runners.name: Diamant Dore
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to a useful French jumper; held every chance before last-fence fall on Irish point debut in November (yielding to soft) and was bought for £125,000 soon afterwards; looks a very interesting recruit for Adrian Keatley.

runners.comment: Shaped well when fourth on last month's rules debut at Catterick; could have a say
runners.name: Dublinofficecallin
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to smart Irish jumper High Class Hero; safely held in two Irish points last May but shaped well before fading into fourth on last month's rules debut at Catterick (good to soft); could have a say.

runners.comment: Outran 33-1 odds when second to Coconut Man over C&D on debut two months ago
runners.name: Kingsman Mail
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to stable's very useful jumper Elvis Mail; outran 33-1 odds when second to Coconut Man over C&D (soft) two months ago and and can better that performance if he settles better in the early stages.

runners.comment: Bought for £42,000 after Irish point win in November; new stable does well in bumpers
runners.name: McElhattan
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to fair hurdler Born In The West; dam placed in points; delivered on debut promise when winning slow-ground Irish point in November, after which he changed hands for £42,000; new stable has good bumper strike-rate; respected.

runners.comment: Brother to two hurdle winners; worth a glance in the betting
runners.name: Melbourne Ghost
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; brother to winners The Niffler (2m-2m4f hurdle) and Lord Maher (1m7f hurdle); dam maiden pointer, out of unraced half-sister to smart jumper Lord Transcend; worth a glance in the betting.

runners.comment: Half-sister to 3m-3m2f hurdle winner Townhill; seemingly the stable second string on debut
runners.name: Oor Wish
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-sister to 3m-3m2f hurdle winner Townhill; dam was unplaced in one bumper, half-sister to a winning chaser and to dam of smart jumpers Royal Regatta and Three Musketeers; riding arrangements suggest Kingsman Mail is the stable's main hope.

runners.breeder: D Dunbar R Binnie & P Spence
runners.comment: Stoutly bred 4yo; stable 0-32 in bumpers during last five seasons
runners.name: Brewdog
runners.spotlight: Third foal; dam point/3m hurdle winner, out of unraced half-sister to Scottish Grand National winner Hello Bud; stable 0-32 in bumpers during last five seasons.

13:38.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: Form figures of 22121 in last five Flat attempts; won comfortably the final time
runners.name: Tarbat Ness
runners.spotlight: Has posted form figures of 22121 in last five Flat attempts, all on turf; scored comfortably at Catterick (2m) the final time; respected assuming he's as effective back on AW.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner last year; unsuited by drop back to 12.5f most recently
runners.name: Billy Bathgate
runners.spotlight: Veteran who scored four times, including twice over C&D, last year; hindered by steady pace and traffic issues over 12.5f most recently; this step back up in trip is a plus.

runners.comment: Chance depends on how well she responds to tongue-tie and visor
runners.name: Inspire Hope
runners.spotlight: Hurdles winner who is 0-6 on Flat; failed to beat a rival in jump races the last twice; chance depends on how well she responds to the fitting of tongue-tie and visor.

runners.comment: Signs of improvement last time (handicap debut); may build on that effort
runners.name: Dollars Dream
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 5yo who showed signs of improvement with keeping-on fifth at Wolverhampton (1m6f; handicap debut) most recently; may build on that effort; possibilities.

runners.comment: Chance of winning may depend on how well he responds to new headgear
runners.name: Young Merlin
runners.spotlight: Veteran who holds place claims on most of his turf form for current yard; chance of winning may depend on how well he responds to new headgear; on a long losing spell.

runners.comment: May do better now handicapping, upped in trip and fitted with headgear
runners.name: Tupero
runners.spotlight: No progress in middle-distance maidens (trained in France on debut) but may do better now handicapping, upped in trip and fitted with tongue-tie/cheekpieces; interesting.

runners.comment: Has a doubt over current form and the trip to some extent
runners.name: Khangai
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced over C&D in the autumn but has done his winning at middle distances; beaten 14l in both starts for new yard, leaving a doubt over his current form.

runners.comment: Maiden; form dipped last time; consistent efforts otherwise for current yard
runners.name: Arcimboldo
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden; form dipped last time but has posted consistent efforts (323) otherwise for current stable and may rebound, in which case he has place possibilities.

14:08.race_name: Midnite Ain't Your Grandad's Bookie Handicap

runners.comment: C&D winner; very slowly away when eighth over C&D in November; very much considered
runners.name: Sibyl Charm
runners.spotlight: C&D winner (a three-time course scorer) but she was very slowly away when eighth back over C&D in November; still very much one to consider after a break.

runners.comment: A two-time C&D scorer but he arrives under something of a cloud
runners.name: Spun To Gold
runners.spotlight: A two-time C&D scorer but he arrives under something of a cloud, only sixth over C&D 15 days ago; he has a bit to prove at present.

runners.comment: Thriving for current yard; excellent Lingfield second 13 days ago; big shout nudged up 1lb
runners.name: Profit Street
runners.spotlight: Course winner who has thrived for the move to James Owen and comes here on the back of an excellent runner-up placing in 6f Lingfield handicap 13 days ago; big shout nudged up 1lb.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner; not disgraced when fifth over C&D last time; ought to be in shake-up
runners.name: Teardrops
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who landed back-to-back C&D handicaps at the end of 2025; not disgraced when fifth of 14 over C&D last time so he ought to be in the shake-up again.

runners.comment: C&D winner; good C&D third only three days ago so she can make her presence felt
runners.name: Penny Mountain
runners.spotlight: Opened her account over C&D on New Year's Day and she followed it up with a good C&D third only three days ago; she can make her presence felt.

runners.comment: On very long losing run but good runner-up at Southwell nine days ago; weighted to go well
runners.name: Court Of Session
runners.spotlight: On a very long losing run but he comes here on the back of a good runner-up finish in 6f Southwell handicap nine days ago; weighted to go well off an unchanged mark.

runners.comment: Did well when fourth at Southwell latest given he helped set a strong pace; in the picture
runners.name: Bad Habits
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at Wolverhampton (7f) in December and did well to come in fourth of 11 at Southwell (7f) last time given he helped set a strong pace; firmly in the picture.

14:38.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Off for 13 months since coming in last of seven on her debut in 6f maiden here
runners.name: Chin Chin Ginny
runners.spotlight: Off for 13 months since coming in last of seven on her debut in 6f maiden here; not easy to warm to.

runners.comment: Shaped well on his debut when C&D fifth; son of Ulysses can take a sizeable step forward
runners.name: Clonquest
runners.spotlight: 16-1, shaped well on his debut when a patiently ridden fifth of nine in C&D novice 42 days ago, running on well late on; this son of Ulysses can take a sizeable step forward now.

runners.comment: Dream Ahead colt who has shown modest form shown in his two runs; may do better
runners.name: Evolve
runners.spotlight: Dream Ahead colt who has shown modest form shown in his two runs, fourth of eight in 6f novice here 12 days ago; he may do better still.

runners.comment: Closely related to an AW winner; this Sioux Nation newcomer rates an interesting prospect
runners.name: Lakota Chief
runners.spotlight: 35,000euros (breeze-up) 2yo; closely related to 5f/6f AW winner Ibn Arabi (RPR 80) and a half-brother to three other winners, notably Nellie Leylax (5f-1m2f Australia; RPR 105); dam placed over 11.6f (RPR 76); this Sioux Nation newcomer rates an interesting prospect.

runners.comment: Is 0-12 and only fourth of five at Southwell ten days ago; needs to bounce back
runners.name: Somebody
runners.spotlight: Capable of fair form but he is 0-12 and saw his run of good form end upped to 7f when only fourth of five in Southwell handicap ten days ago; well in the mix if bouncing back in a change of headgear.

runners.comment: A half-brother to five winners; this son of Recoletos is very much one to consider
runners.name: Star Of Emerald
runners.spotlight: 8,000euros yearling; half-brother to five winners, notably Beautiful Heroine (9.7f-1m4f Group 3; RPR 106) and Big Blue Spirit (US 6.5f-1m; RPR 101); dam twice-raced sister to French 1,000 Guineas winner Bluemamba; this son of Recoletos is very much one to consider.

runners.comment: Time Test filly; the betting can prove an accurate guide to this newcomer
runners.name: Evelyns Garden
runners.spotlight: Time Test filly; dam, 7f 2yo/1m AW winner (RPR 77), is a half-sister to useful 7f winner Castle Harbour; the betting can prove an accurate guide to this newcomer.

runners.comment: Showcasing filly; encouraging sixth at Lingfield 41 days ago; she can do better still
runners.name: Maria Da Silva
runners.spotlight: Showcasing filly who took a step forward from her debut when sixth of 12 in 1m Lingfield maiden 41 days ago; she can do better still so is no forlorn hope.

runners.comment: Still green when fifth here last time; first start under the care of Stephen Hanlon
runners.name: Populus
runners.spotlight: Ex-Ann Duffield; still looked green but she built on her debut when a keeping-on fifth of 13 in 6f maiden here 25 days ago; has more to offer on first start under the care of Stephen Hanlon.

runners.comment: Sergei Prokofiev filly; the market can guide for this debutante
runners.name: Spirit Of Tokyo
runners.owner: The Tokyo Bay Syndicate And P Kirby
runners.spotlight: 1,500gns yearling; Sergei Prokofiev filly who is a half-sister to three winners, including Lubinka (1m4f AW; RPR 99) and Albert Camus (1m2f-1m4f AW; RPR 94); dam, French 1m7f winner, is a half-sister to French 1,000 Guineas winner Danseuse Du Soir; the market can guide.

runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival in maiden here on her debut 25 days ago; significantly more needed
runners.name: Thependleburyfox
runners.spotlight: 33-1, failed to beat a rival in 6f maiden here on her debut 25 days ago; significantly more is required.

runners.comment: Running well until eighth last time; this course scorer can get back on track
runners.name: Em Jay Kay
runners.spotlight: Running well until only eighth of 11 in 6f Wolverhampton handicap 17 days ago; it would come as no surprise to see this course winner get back on track.

runners.comment: C&D winner who followed that with a very good C&D second latest; bold show on the cards
runners.name: Digital
runners.owner: Fine Claret Racing And Mrs R Carr
runners.spotlight: Cheekpieces were back on when ending a long losing run last month and he followed it with a very good second (also C&D) 12 days ago; just 1lb higher and another bold show is on the cards.

runners.comment: On a lengthy losing sequence but solid C&D third 12 days ago; in the mix once more
runners.name: La Rochette
runners.spotlight: On a lengthy losing sequence but she comes here on the back of a solid C&D third 12 days ago; in the mix once more.

runners.comment: Back on track when third two weeks ago; course scorer can go well again
runners.name: Hes An Angel
runners.spotlight: It's now 11 outings since his last success but he got back on track when third of nine in 5f Wolverhampton handicap two weeks ago; this course scorer can make his presence felt.

runners.comment: Signed off for Ann Duffield with a creditable C&D fourth; needs shortlisting for new yard
runners.name: Azucena
runners.spotlight: Signed off for Ann Duffield with a creditable fourth of seven over C&D last month; tried in different headgear for her new handler and she needs shortlisting.

runners.comment: Below par in pair of 6f h'caps here for new yard recently; blinkers are reached for now
runners.name: Classy Clarets
runners.spotlight: Ended his time with Alice Haynes below par and he has fared no better in a pair of 6f handicaps here for his new yard recently; blinkers are reached for now.

15:40.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Had excuses when seventh of ten at Southwell (1m) 53 days ago; tough mark
runners.name: Bowood
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back over C&D (lower grade contests) across October and November; didn't get a clear run when seventh of ten at Southwell (1m) 53 days ago; likes it here, and is yet to win for anyone else bar Elle-May Croot, but close to a career best is required from this mark.

runners.comment: Runner-up (Eve's Boy a nose behind) over C&D in October; absent since; headgear removed
runners.name: Criminal Shore
runners.spotlight: 1-13; runner-up in two of his three starts since fitted with a visor, including over C&D (Eve's Boy a nose behind in third) in October; absent since and it is slightly surprising to see the headgear removed; mark remains manageable, though.

runners.comment: Short-head defeat (The Green Man third) over C&D 12 days ago; 1lb higher
runners.name: Flying Fletcher
runners.spotlight: Yet to win beyond 6f but has finished runner-up three times here (7f-1m) since September, including when beaten a short-head by a subsequent winner (The Green Man a luckless third) 12 days ago; 1lb higher (was ridden by a claimer last time) with Shane Gray back aboard.

runners.comment: Luckless C&D third (Flying Fletcher second) last time; could easily make amends
runners.name: The Green Man
runners.spotlight: Comfortably won lower-grade 7f handicap here (Bajan Bandit second) in December; might have followed up over C&D at the start of this month but for being repeatedly short of room inside the final two furlongs; 1lb higher but remains well treated on peak form; major player.

runners.comment: Failed to settle when seventh (behind three of these) over C&D last time
runners.name: Eves Boy
runners.spotlight: 1-13, and it would be fair to say that he is yet to fulfill his potential; finished third (Criminal Shore second) under Paul Mulrennan in October but failed to settle in newly applied cheekpieces when only seventh (also C&D; three of these rivals ahead) last time; Mulrennan back aboard.

runners.comment: Consistent; had run of race when weakening fifth over C&D 12 days ago; needs more
runners.name: Bajan Bandit
runners.spotlight: Consistent since winning off 4lb lower here (7f) in early December, finishing runner-up on his next two starts (including to The Green Man); had the run of the race when a weakening fifth over C&D (Flying Fletcher and The Green Man ahead) earlier this month; needs more.

runners.comment: 2nd here (7f) in December; less effective over further since and looks the least likeliest
runners.name: Lessay
runners.spotlight: Scored off 2lb lower at Wolverhampton in early December and finished runner-up here (also 7f) one week later; less effective (at up to 8.5f) since, and this stablemate of Bajan Bandit looks the least likeliest in a competitive contest.

16:15.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap

runners.comment: Scored over 6f latest; could have pace to cope with dropping back to 5f (first attempt).
runners.name: Heavenly Heather
runners.spotlight: Scored over 6f here latest, reward for a series of consistent efforts; although her other win came over 7f here (200-1) on Good Friday, she travelled smoothly through that latest race, so could have the pace to cope with dropping back to 5f (first go); on a career-high mark.

runners.comment: C&D winner (from 4lb lower) in November; mostly consistent since; must enter calculations.
runners.name: Lethal Nymph
runners.spotlight: Gained just his second AW win, keeping on well over C&D (from 4lb lower) in November; mostly consistent since, a creditable third - while possibly a bit stretched by the 6f trip - at Wolverhampton (15-2) latest; has won from higher marks previously (in 2022), so must enter calculations.

runners.comment: Notched another C&D win on New Year's Day; 3lb rise offset by redeployment of Rhys Elliott
runners.name: Kings Crown
runners.spotlight: Three C&D wins; form figures here since October read 36121; got the better of Blue Lakota on New Year's Day and his trainer seeks to stave off the attentions of the handicapper (3lb higher) by redeploying the talented 5lb claimer Rhys Elliott; likely to be thereabouts.

runners.comment: Three course wins; shaped encouragingly in added headgear at Southwell latest; noteworthy.
runners.name: Monks Dream
runners.spotlight: Only 1lb above last winning mark, when getting the better of King's Crown (third) over C&D in March; shaped encouragingly, keeping on, in this newly applied headgear at Southwell (5f, fourth; 10-1) latest; returning to this stiffer track (three course wins) can assist; noteworthy.

runners.comment: Seeking first win (0-12); turned over in a three-runner Musselburgh novice in September.
runners.name: Farandaway
runners.spotlight: Still seeking first win (0-12) and turned over in a three-runner Musselburgh novice, at odds of 30-100, in September; runner-up in two of his four AW starts, but does lack confirmed race-fitness in a race where a stronger case can be made for each of his rivals; easing mark.

16:45.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Apprentice Handicap (Part Of Racing Excellence Initiative)

runners.comment: Superbly placed, running up four-timer here (7f-1m) through Nov & Dec; fifth win possible.
runners.name: Aisling Oscar
runners.spotlight: Superbly placed, running up a four-timer here (7f-1m) through November and December, always doing enough latest; a 5lb claimer is deployed in a bid to stay ahead of the handicapper (another 4lb higher); tough to beat, with 7f probably his optimum.

runners.comment: Failed to kick on positively from breakthrough success (7f); fifth over 1m here recently.
runners.name: Believe In Lies
runners.spotlight: Pounced late to take a Carlisle maiden handicap (7f, good to firm; 15-2) in August; failed to kick on positively from that breakthrough success but wasn't beaten far when fifth to Trais Fluors (Pallas Lord second) over 1m here (22-1) on New Year's Day.

runners.comment: Stuck head down to repel Little Ted over C&D (from 2lb lower) latest; 3lb claimer booked.
runners.name: Wyvern
runners.spotlight: Missed the break when fifth to Aisling Oscar over 1m here (7-2, beaten 3l) prior to Christmas; stuck his head down to repel Little Ted over C&D (from 2lb lower) subsequently; Alfie Redman's 3lb claim is helpful from a handicapping perspective; an obvious threat.

runners.comment: No win for 14 months; weakened when partnered by D. Goucher at Wolverhampton penultimate.
runners.name: Amaysmont
runners.spotlight: No win for 14 months, and rated a whopping 20lb higher when scoring for Richard Fahey over 1m here in June 2022; weakened when partnered by Donovan Goucher at Wolverhampton (7f) on penultimate start; positives not immediately obvious.

runners.comment: Nine course wins (7f-1m); knocking on the door lately; closely matched with Aisling Oscar.
runners.name: Pallas Lord
runners.spotlight: Nine course wins (7f-1m), the most recent when justifying favouritism (from 4lb higher) in March; knocking on the door lately, third to Aisling Oscar (penultimate), and chinned close home by Trais Fluors latest; likely to give his usual honest effort from the front.

runners.comment: Stepped forward on second start for Ian Williams at Southwell (7f) last week; 3lb higher.
runners.name: Moyowasi
runners.spotlight: Ex Charles Hills; stepped forward to score on second start for Ian Williams at Southwell (7f; 12-1) last week, keeping on well in a low-grade 0-55; no reason why he shouldn't go well again from this 3lb higher mark; one to consider.

runners.comment: 0-14; closing third (6f) on New Year's Day - that form boosted since; effective over 7f.
runners.name: Sovereign Class
runners.spotlight: 14-race maiden, beaten by a nose over 6f here in November; kept on from rear into a closing third (6f) on New Year's Day, that form given a boost with the winner Spartan Fighter going in again on Saturday; she's fine over 7f; a similar race should fall her way eventually.

runners.comment: 0-15 on AW; fourth to Homme De Fer at Wolverhampton (7f) six weeks ago; others preferred.
runners.name: Rain Cap
runners.spotlight: 8-59 on turf but continues to seek his first AW win (0-15); runner-up off this mark at Redcar (6f) in November, and ran at least as well when fourth to Homme De Fer at Wolverhampton (7f) six weeks ago; others preferred.

16:30.race_name: Midnite: Built For 2026 Not 2006 Apprentice Handicap

runners.comment: Both turf wins at 5f on sharp tracks; no match for Popular Dream's finish over C&D latest
runners.name: Brazilian Belle
runners.spotlight: Both turf wins over 5f on sharp tracks; not yet as good on AW and she was a sitting duck over C&D last week once Popular Dream arrived on the scene; has a turnaround in weights but still has some work to do.

runners.comment: Unraced at Southwell but good 5f Tapeta winner at Wolverhampton latest; back up 3lb
runners.name: Emperors Son
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.spotlight: Unraced at Southwell but he's versatile ground-wise and acts well on Tapeta elsewhere; ran well in better 5f races than this in 2025 and took advantage of a favourable mark when returned to 5f at Wolverhampton recently; back up 3lb but Warren Fentiman is good value for his claim; solid.

runners.comment: Steep rise in weights for Wolverhampton win in October but H Vigors' 7lb claim is helpful
runners.name: Beaumadier
runners.spotlight: Steep rise in the weights for clear 5f Wolverhampton win in October and has work to do with Popular Dream on C&D form the time before; outpointed by Emperor's Son at Wolverhampton recently but in-form Harry Vigors' 7lb claim sweetens the pill and he shouldn't be far away.

runners.comment: Four C&D wins; back on song last week; needs a bit more under penalty but respected
runners.name: Popular Dream
runners.spotlight: Four C&D wins include one last week when winning with authority; 5lb penalty asks for a bit more against in-form rivals but Taryn Langley has started the year well and takes off a useful 3lb; respected.

runners.comment: Useful 2yo in Ireland; not the same horse in Britain; drop to 5f needs to revitalise
runners.name: Hostility
runners.spotlight: Useful 2yo in Ireland but not the same horse in Britain, despite hefty market support on occasions; he might have new life breathed into him by the drop to 5f with cheekpieces refitted but couldn't count on it.

runners.comment: Multiple 5f wins, two here; off since September and tends to need the run after a break
runners.name: Birkenhead
runners.spotlight: Front-runs; multiple 5f wins include two on this track, one on Tapeta, but it's probably best not to expect too much on first run since September.

runners.comment: Six 5f wins at Wolverhampton; has C&D form but high in weights and others more likely
runners.name: Basholo
runners.spotlight: All six AW wins over 5f at Wolverhampton, most recently in November, and none off this high a mark; has gone close over C&D but she runs only intermittently here which tells its own tale; others look more likely.

runners.comment: Won three sprints between September and December, including C&D; off day latest
runners.name: Sams Hope
runners.owner: D Morgan And K J Parris
runners.spotlight: Has flourished for this yard, winning three at 6f and 5f between September and November, including over C&D; however, she was a long way from doing herself justice here last time so others are higher up the list.

runners.comment: Six turf wins but 0-17 on AW; out of sorts but getting better treated by the race
runners.name: Honour Your Dreams
runners.spotlight: Six turf wins but 0-17 on AW and he hasn't found his feet for this yard as yet; getting better handicapped by the race but remains with plenty to prove; hood fitted latest but not today.

17:00.race_name: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Classified Stakes (Div I)

runners.comment: Sound performances this year, winning at Southwell then second at Lingfield; respected
runners.name: Call Glory
runners.spotlight: Sound performances this year, winning 6f handicap at Southwell (ended a long losing spell) then running-on second in 7f classified contest at Lingfield; respected.

runners.comment: Form at classified level includes a close third in a division of this race last year
runners.name: Evoluir
runners.spotlight: Has become inconsistent but is capable of being involved; form at classified level includes a close third in a division of this race last year and success at Wolverhampton the following month.

runners.comment: Weak claims on form; change of headgear
runners.name: For What Its Worth
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden who has weak claims on form; failed to beat a rival in handicaps on last two starts; cheekpieces replace blinkers.

runners.breeder: Mrs D Joly D Powell & A Richardson
runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival in last two appearances; record is 0-14
runners.name: Galette
runners.spotlight: Has made the frame a few times but failed to beat a rival in last two appearances (lost action latest); record is 0-14.

runners.comment: Has plenty of form at this level, including course win; return to Tapeta is a plus
runners.name: Headshot
runners.spotlight: Has plenty of form at this level, including wins at Southwell in 2024 and Wolverhampton in 2025; below best on Polytack reappearance three days ago but this return to Tapeta looks ideal; in the mix.

runners.comment: Solid effort at Newcastle four days ago when making classified debut; leading player
runners.name: Laurens Dream
runners.spotlight: Both wins at Newcastle in November 2024; solid effort at same venue (7f) four days ago when making classified debut and wearing first-time cheekpieces (retained); leading contender at the weights.

runners.comment: Poor claims on her sprinting form
runners.name: Lilac Wood
runners.spotlight: Poor claims on her sprinting form, latterly in Southwell handicaps; new trip needs to make a big difference.

runners.comment: Close second in a division of this contest 12 months ago; enters calculations
runners.name: My Boy Jack
runners.spotlight: Not entirely solid on recent handicap efforts, latest over C&D; however, has frame possibilities judged on the majority of his classified form, including close second in a division of this contest 12 months ago.

runners.comment: Pair of duck eggs at Newcastle since switched to AW
runners.name: Our Nicola
runners.spotlight: Placed only once on turf; pair of duck eggs at Newcastle since switched to AW; first-time headgear needs to prompt improvement.

runners.comment: Poor chance on ratings
runners.name: Purpendicular
runners.spotlight: Shaped with a bit of promise on penultimate start but that's the only positive thing to say; poor chance on ratings.

runners.comment: Has failed to back up debut figure
runners.name: Zaramara
runners.spotlight: Has failed to back up debut figure, which is modest anyway; posted her worst effort last time.

17:30.race_name: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Classified Stakes (Div II)

runners.comment: Easy success in similar event at Newcastle three days ago on third run for new yard
runners.name: Pink Socks
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish mare who easily justified favouritism in 1m classified event at Newcastle three days ago on third start for new yard; likely to be as effective back down in trip; looks capable of defying 4lb penalty.

runners.breeder: David John Brown & Whistbury Manor Stud
runners.comment: Maiden who has frame possibilities on plenty of form; second over C&D last time
runners.name: Aim For The Bull
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden (0-17) and tends to hang right; however, has frame possibilities on plenty of form, including creditable second in C&D handicap last time.

runners.comment: Has gone well fresh; interesting dropped to this level on return from layoff
runners.name: American Rose
runners.spotlight: Gained her wins in 2022 and 2024; inconsistent since the latter performance but has gone well fresh several times and is interesting dropped to this level on return from ten-week layoff.

runners.comment: Mostly poor form since wins over longer trips last April/June
runners.name: Anificas Beauty
runners.spotlight: Mostly poor form since her wins over longer trips last April/June; admittedly perhaps needed her reappearance effort three days ago.

runners.comment: Remains a maiden but could go well at this level on reappearance
runners.name: Captain Pickles
runners.spotlight: Has some encouraging handicap form; remains a maiden after 16 starts but could go well at this level on reappearance.

runners.comment: May be fully recharged on return from deserved seven-week break
runners.name: Embarked
runners.spotlight: Scored only once during a busy 2025 campaign; however, may be fully recharged on return from a deserved seven-week break.

runners.comment: Dual winner at Southwell and is capable of being involved in this grade
runners.name: Kodebreaker
runners.spotlight: Losing run is mounting up but recent form features a good second in Wolverhampton handicap; dual winner at Southwell and is capable of being involved in this grade.

runners.comment: No improvement for the drop to this level last time
runners.name: Nutcracker
runners.spotlight: Showed no improvement for the drop to this level at Southwell (1m) last time, taking record to 0-7; still not solid in terms of form.

runners.comment: Weak claims on form
runners.name: Sharp Call
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden and has weak claims on form; yet to be placed.

runners.comment: Went close on penultimate start; three-time Southwell winner
runners.name: Wrath Of Hector
runners.spotlight: Raced mainly over 6f last year, best effort when going close at Nottingham on penultimate start; effective at 7f in the past and is a three-time Southwell winner.

18:00.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Handicap

runners.comment: Ended 2025 with success at Lingfield 13 days ago; up 2lb but very much one to consider
runners.name: Invited
runners.spotlight: Signed off for 2025 with a fourth success in 1m Lingfield handicap 13 days ago; up 2lb but this course winner is very much one to consider.

runners.comment: On a losing run but not disgraced when sixth in handicap here 12 days ago; not ruled out
runners.name: Secret Guest
runners.spotlight: On a losing run but he wasn't disgraced given he challenged wide when sixth of 12 in 6f handicap here 12 days ago; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Course scorer; off since good Carlisle second in June so needs to hit the ground running
runners.name: Good Morning Alex
runners.spotlight: Course scorer but he's been off the track since posting a good second in 1m Carlisle handicap in June; needs to hit the ground running on his comeback.

runners.comment: Gelded and on up for current yard, bagging C&D handicap 53 days ago; weighted to go close
runners.name: Shiplake
runners.spotlight: Gelded and on the up since joining his current yard, bagging a C&D handicap 53 days ago; up 7lb but still looks weighted to go close again.

runners.comment: Ended time with Tim Easterby with good Newmarket fifth; likely player for in-form new yard
runners.name: Candonomore
runners.spotlight: A three-time 7f/1m scorer in 2025 for Tim Easterby and he signed off with a good fifth in 7f Newmarket handicap in October; since changed hands for 28,000gns and rates a likely player (has won after a break) for a yard among the winners.

runners.comment: Back on track when runner-up at Wolverhampton; veteran can go well off the same mark
runners.name: The Turpinator
runners.spotlight: Got right back on track when runner-up in 7f Wolverhampton handicap a week ago, doing well to come off a steady pace; this veteran can go well off the same mark.

18:30.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: Stayed on well to win over C&D last week; penalised but down in class; each-way shout
runners.name: Showtime Mahomes
runners.spotlight: He was winning for the second time over C&D when keeping on strongly last week; has a 4lb penalty to shoulder but this represents an ease in class; each-way shout.

runners.comment: Off the mark when winning C&D handicap last month; needs more to follow up in a deep race
runners.name: Ottawa
runners.spotlight: Two runs over C&D, finishing third last September and then winning a Class 6 here 26 days ago; a 3lb rise in a competitive race could find him out.

runners.comment: Bumped into handicap blot when 2nd (front two clear) at Wolverhampton latest; big player
runners.name: Cargin Bhui
runners.spotlight: Infrequent winner and he was beaten as an odds-on favourite at Wolverhampton 11 days ago (6f); he did bump into a well-handicapped James Owen stable switcher on that occasion (pair clear), however, and it was a run that confirmed he was primed to strike; up 2lb but high on the list.

runners.comment: Well short of his best on last two starts but now drops in class with his yard going well
runners.name: Pickering Castle
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden who has been well short of his best on his last two runs (drawn wide latest); drops into a Class 6 on his return from seven weeks off; a revival isn't out of the question with the yard going well.

runners.comment: C&D winner; ready Kempton win last September; sharper for latest run; draw widest
runners.name: Early Release
runners.spotlight: C&D winner as a 2yo; off the mark for 2025 when making all in a 6f handicap at Kempton last September; not at best 17 days ago but that was after a 100-day break; capable off this mark but has drawn the widest stall.

runners.comment: Still seeking a first AW win but his penultimate run was promising; not so good latest
runners.name: Sub Thirteen
runners.spotlight: Yet to win on AW but had few chances and his penultimate effort at Wolverhampton was encouraging; this looks competitive for the grade though and others appeal more for win purposes.

runners.comment: 12yo who wasn't beaten far in either run for new yard last autumn; needs more to win here
runners.name: Delagate This Lord
runners.spotlight: Veteran who wasn't beaten far in two runs for this yard last autumn; slipping down the weights but he needs to raise his game a notch.

runners.comment: Multiple AW winner but this is a rare 6f run and others appeal more
runners.name: Gustav Graves
runners.spotlight: Nine-time AW winner at other tracks; arrives in good order but this is a rare run over 6f and others may see it out better.

runners.comment: Promise over 5f here last month but no so good behind Ottawa over C&D 26 days ago
runners.name: Dapperling
runners.spotlight: Stayed on from a poor position to take third in a 5f handicap here last month, her second run for this yard; unable to back it up behind Ottawa here 26 days ago; not a solid option but she has slipped down the weights and a better run wouldn't be a major surprise.

runners.comment: Expensive to follow for current stable; latest C&D 2nd gives him solid form claims though
runners.name: Minnesota Lad
runners.spotlight: Ran his best race for a while when keeping on well for second over C&D last month; that took his record for current stable to 0-17, however, and he's started at 17-2 or shorter in all bar one of them; has the ability to feature but struggling to get the job done.

runners.comment: Veteran on a losing run of 18; work to do with Cargin Bhui on latest Wolverhampton run
runners.name: Good Earth
runners.spotlight: Losing run up to 18 but he has run well on his last three attempts at this trip, latterly keeping on for fourth at Wolverhampton 11 days ago; finished behind Cargin Bhui on that occasion and may do so again.

runners.breeder: Miss S Sands & Mrs Lynette Andersen
runners.comment: 0-10 but he ended 2025 with four second-place finishes; should be involved once again
runners.name: Clover Time
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden but he ended 2025 with four second-place finishes, the latest at Wolverhampton 17 days ago; no obvious reason why he wouldn't make another bold bid.

19:00.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Achieved little in 7f event at Newcastle
runners.name: Avalon Mill Mehmas
runners.spotlight: Never dangerous in 7f event at Newcastle, achieving little on the figures.

runners.comment: Hinted at ability in Lingfield contest last January for Charlie Johnston
runners.name: Marianne Mozart
runners.spotlight: Hinted at ability in Lingfield contest (7f) last January for Charlie Johnston; sold for 8,000gns since; check the market signals.

runners.comment: Half-sister to two AW winners for her owner; duly showed promise in Wolverhampton event
runners.name: Autumn Affair
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to two AW winners for her owner; duly showed promise, beating all bar the favourite, in 6f event at Wolverhampton; respected.

runners.comment: One of the main players judged on the pick of her form for Richard Hannon; stable debut
runners.name: Love Alive
runners.spotlight: Best efforts for Richard Hannon when fourth at Ascot (6f) and Sandown (5f); sold for 20,000gns since last run; one of the main form players.

runners.comment: 15,000gns yearling; half-sister to two AW scorers; suitably bred newcomer
runners.name: Maybe Soon
runners.spotlight: 15,000gns yearling; Supremacy half-sister to AW scorers Jersey Rocs (1m/8.6f; RPR 73) and Bride Tree (7f; 67); suitably bred newcomer.

runners.comment: 17,000gns foal; by Mohaather; looks one of the better types among the debutantes
runners.name: Pantheon Princess
runners.spotlight: 17,000gns foal; Mohaather half-sister to 5f/6f winner Keke (RPR 105); looks one of the better types among the debutantes.

runners.comment: Latest 7f effort suggests this drop in trip may prompt improvement
runners.name: Power Of Chora
runners.spotlight: RPR of only 55 in a couple of 7f contests at Southwell; however, latest effort suggests this drop in trip may prompt a bigger figure.

runners.comment: Charming Thought filly; yard not associated with debut scorers
runners.name: Sequential
runners.spotlight: Charming Thought sibling to two winners, notably The Meter (6.5f/7f including AW/Greece; RPR 69); yard not associated with debut scorers.

runners.comment: Recorded a meagre RPR in Chelmsford event
runners.name: Sirhana
runners.spotlight: Bit of late headway in 6f event at Chelmsford but recorded a meagre RPR; perhaps one for handicaps later on.

runners.breeder: Mrs Liz Barry & Mr Luke Barry
runners.comment: Last of 14 in Curragh maiden for Jessica Harrington but this is a much weaker level
runners.name: Starfinch
runners.owner: Mrs Frank Barry & Mrs Luke Barry
runners.spotlight: Last of 14 in Curragh maiden (7f) for Jessica Harrington but may do much better at this weaker level; still in same ownership; interesting.

runners.comment: RPR of just 49 in both starts, latest over C&D
runners.name: Tabby Kat
runners.spotlight: Out of a winner for her stable but has posted an RPR of just 49 in both starts, latest over C&D; may be more interesting in handicaps shortly.

runners.comment: £1,000 yearling; by Iffraaj; market instructive
runners.name: Thunder Pants
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.spotlight: £1,000 yearling; by Iffraaj and first foal of twice-raced half-sister to useful 6f winner Marie Of Lyon; market instructive.

19:30.race_name: Midnite Ain't Your Grandad's Bookie Handicap

runners.comment: May remain competitive but it's a long while since he defied this sort of mark
runners.name: Alligator Alley
runners.owner: R J H Limited And Ruth Carr
runners.spotlight: Ran respectably in his bid for a four-timer most recently; this 9yo may remain competitive but it's a long while since he defied this sort of mark.

runners.comment: Latest performance took his Newcastle record to 7-11; only 2-34 elsewhere
runners.name: Paddys Day
runners.spotlight: Latest performance took his Newcastle record to 7-11; looks as good as ever but he's by no means certain to follow up, with record elsewhere only 2-34.

runners.comment: Good effort last time when bidding for C&D hat-trick; solid contender
runners.name: Ziggys Triton
runners.spotlight: Good effort last time when bidding for a C&D hat-trick, taking overall record at Southwell to 23112; solid contender, assuming he takes well to change of headgear.

runners.comment: Shaped encouragingly at Wolverhampton (third run for new yard) when last seen
runners.name: Atomic Force
runners.spotlight: Group 2 winner as a 2yo then had a long spell in Hong Kong; shaped encouragingly at Wolverhampton (third start for new yard) when last seen; enters calculations.

runners.comment: Has lost his form since hat-trick; revival is needed on reappearance
runners.name: Spring Is Sprung
runners.spotlight: Hat-trick in the Sky Bet Sunday Series was the big highlight of his 2025 campaign; lost his form subsequently; revival is needed on reappearance.

runners.comment: Record of 4-12 on AW; ran creditably on last two starts; in the mix
runners.name: Fidelius
runners.spotlight: Record of 4-12 on AW features a defeat of Alligator Alley at Newcastle in November; couple of creditable efforts since, close third at Lingfield latest; in the mix.

runners.breeder: Executors Of The Late Mr J L C Pearce
runners.comment: Remains on a long losing spell but is a stone below last winning mark
runners.name: Juan Les Pins
runners.spotlight: Ran encouragingly (very close third) at Newcastle on reappearance and only third attempt over 5f; remains on a long losing spell but is a stone below last winning mark.

20:00.race_name: Midnite Are Upping The Betting Game Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: In good form at Newcastle (1m4f/1m2f); return to this trip will suit; first course run
runners.name: Machete
runners.spotlight: Back in good form on Newcastle AW since returning from absence, with narrow defeats over 1m4f and 1m2f either side of a win over the latter trip, when needing every yard of it to prevail close home; having first course run but should continue the good work.

runners.comment: C&D novice winner; in fine form back on AW of late, coming clear at Wolverhampton (1m4f)
runners.name: Cannon Rock
runners.spotlight: C&D novice winner; has flourished since back on AW of late, never giving an inch in a thrilling finish at Kempton (1m3f; blinkers replaced cheekpieces) last month, then won going away at Wolverhampton (1m4f) since; back up 5lb but that's not too harsh given his earlier form; bang there.

runners.comment: Saw out 1m6f on turf handicap debut; well clear in 1m4f Wolverhampton novice since
runners.name: Codiak
runners.spotlight: Has worn headgear for all five runs; was only marginally outstayed on handicap debut at Redcar (1m6f; off 7lb lower) and the return to 1m4f suited when galloping clear of an ordinary field in a Wolverhampton novice since; should be open to some improvement but his mettle will be tested.

runners.comment: Weighted to go well on best C&D form; creditable 2nd in higher grade latest
runners.name: Robusto
runners.spotlight: Often leads; weighted to go well on C&D form last May and he ran another useful race when runner-up 12 days ago when back under the same conditions for the first time since; bold show likely in this easier grade.

runners.comment: Course wins at 1m3f and 1m4f; in good form at Lingfield this month; can be involved
runners.name: Charlies Choice
runners.spotlight: Course wins over 1m3f and 1m4f last winter; latest success was on Lingfield Polytrack (1m4f) this month but things didn't pan out so well when flying home to take a late third there on Saturday; every chance of being involved back on this more galloping track.

runners.comment: Has won and close 3rd on most recent 1m4f runs; may yet improve a little; course debut
runners.name: Moon Sniper
runners.owner: C L A Edginton & A J Niven
runners.spotlight: Acts well on the other two Tapeta courses, winning at Newcastle in the autumn and losing out in a flurry of heads at Wolverhampton (both at 1m4f); fair effort over 1m6f after Christmas and may yet do better in truly run race back at this trip on course debut.
